Welcome to ds-utils’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class dsUtils.Aggregator(aggregation_keys, aggregation_strategy, vectorizor_compatibility=True)[source]¶

This class allows for the transformation of an unaggregated data frame into an aggregated one (Vectorizor compatible).

Parameters

  • aggregation_keys (list) – List of columns used for the aggregation (group by).

  • aggregation_strategy (dict) – Dictionary {‘column’: aggregation_function}. Built-in aggregation functions exist as counter and normalized_counter.

  • vectorizor_compatibility (bool) – Custom arg. with default value = False. Use True for exploratory data analysis (categorical features will not be mapped to dictionary).

fit(df)[source]¶

Fit the class attributes according to the provided data frame.

Parameters

df (pandas DataFrame) – The data frame to be aggregated.

Returns

self (object)

transform(df)[source]¶

Transform df into agg_df which is Vectorizor compatible.

Parameters

df (pandas DataFrame) – The data frame to be aggregated.

Returns

The resulting aggregated data frame.

Return type

agg_df (pandas Dataframe)

class dsUtils.Counterizor(ignored_columns=None, sharp_categorical_dict=None)[source]¶

This class allows for the transformation of categorical features into Counters for Vectorizor compatibility.

Parameters

  • ignored_colums (list) – Leave these columns alone!

  • sharp_categorical_dict (dict) – Dictionary {‘column’: {‘sep’: “#”, ‘norm’: True/False} }.

fit(df)[source]¶

Fit the class attributes according to the provided data frame.

Parameters

df (pandas DataFrame) – The data frame to be counterized.

Returns

self (Counterizor)

transform(df)[source]¶

Transform df in place.

Parameters

df (pandas DataFrame) – The data frame to be counterized.

Returns

The resulting counterized data frame.

Return type

df (pandas Dataframe)

class dsUtils.Preprocessor[source]¶

This class allows for the complete pre-processing of a DataFrame into a sparse matrix for model input.

fit_transform(df, pruning_frequency=None, do_not_use=None, sharp_categorical_dict=None, na_strategy=<dsUtils.MeanStrategy object>, variance_threshold=None, low_memory=True)[source]¶

Pre-process input_files for the training phase. Once completed, you should save the resulting Preprocessor object for the predict phase.

Parameters

  • df (pandas DataFrame) – dataframe to be pre-processed.

  • pruning_frequency (float or None) – Frequency below which value in categorical features are pruned (set to misc). (deactivated by default)

  • do_not_use (list or None) – Leave these columns alone!

  • sharp_categorical_dict (dict) –

    {‘column’: {‘sep’: “#”, ‘norm’: True/False} }.

    If not provided, program looks for columns ending in _cat and automatically creates an entry in the dict with value {‘sep’: “#”, ‘norm’: True}.

  • na_strategy (Strategy) – Strategy used to impute missing values.

  • variance_threshold (float or None) – Threshold for variance selector. (deactivated by default)

  • low_memory (bool) – If True, counterizor will not use parallel computation. default: False

Returns

namedtuple(‘data’, [‘X’, ‘other’, ‘names’])

data.X (scipy sparse matrix): model input

data.other (pandas DataFrame): columns unused

transform(df, low_memory=True)[source]¶

Pre-process input_files using the same pre-processing parameters used for the training phase.

Parameters

  • df (pandas DataFrame) – dataframe to be pre-processed.

  • low_memory (bool) – If True, counterizor will not use parallel computation. default: False

Returns

namedtuple(‘data’, [‘X’, ‘other’, ‘names’])

data.X (scipy sparse matrix): model input

data.other (pandas DataFrame): columns unused

class dsUtils.Prunificator(ignored_columns=None, sharp_categorical_dict=None, frequency=0.0001)[source]¶

This class allows to remove values in categorical features whose frequency is less than frequency.

class dsUtils.Sparsifior(keys=None, target=None)[source]¶

SPARSIFIOR input = DataFrame + sparse matrix output = namedtuple(‘data’, [‘keys’, ‘features’, ‘X’, ‘y’])

class dsUtils.Strategy[source]¶

Skeleton for missing values imputation strategy.

Note

Metaclass! You should define your own derived class.

class dsUtils.VarianceSelector(threshold)[source]¶

Feature selector that removes all low variance features.

fit(X)[source]¶

Learn empirical variances from X.

Parameters

X (array-like or sparse matrix of shape = [n_samples, n_features]) – Sample vectors from which to compute variances.

Returns

self

Return type

object

fit_transform(X)[source]¶

Fit to data, then transform it.

Parameters

X (array of shape [n_samples, n_features]) – Training set.

Returns

X_new – Transformed array.

Return type

array of shape [n_samples, n_features_new]

select_features(features)[source]¶

Select features with enough variance.

Parameters

features (array of shape [n_features]) – Names of the features.

Returns

selected_features – An array with only the names of the selected_features.

Return type

array of shape [n_selected_features]

transform(X)[source]¶

Reduce X to the selected features.

Parameters

X (array of shape [n_samples, n_features]) – The input samples.

Returns

X_r – The input samples with only the selected features.

Return type

array of shape [n_samples, n_selected_features]
